Detailed Description

Derived from Surface, representing a plane.

The plane is considered infinite, and can reflect and refract (through) Launchables It can be intersected by a Launchable

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

double  reflect,
double  transp,
Texture *  tex,
Point3D  one_point,
Vector3D  normal 
) [inline]

Constructor.

Constructor of class Plane

Parameters:
absorp : absorption probability
reflect : reflection probability
transp : transparency probability
tex : pointer to the texture of this surface
one_point : one point of this plane used to position it into space
normal : a normal of the plane

Member Function Documentation

std::pair< Ray, Ray > Plane::divide_ray ( const Couple3D &  couple,
const Ray &  ray 
) const [virtual]

Returns the division (reflected/refracted) of an incoming ray at the couple position.

Parameters:
ray : the incoming ray to divide
couple : first parameter contains the intersection point, second contains the normal at this intersection

This function divides a ray into a reflected and refracted ray only if the new ray can exist (probabilities not null)

Implements Shape.

Color Plane::get_color_at ( const Point3D &  inters_point  )  const [virtual]

Returns the color at this point of the plane.

Parameters:
inters_point : an intersection point where we seek the color

This function determines the color at the given point of the surface It is related to the get_color(double, double) of the Texture where the two doubles represent coordinates for the texture map.

Implements Shape.

Couple3D Plane::get_nearest_intersection_with_normal ( const Launchable &  l  )  const [virtual]

Returns the nearest intersection (point/normal) of the given launchable with this plane.

Parameters:
l : the incoming launchable to find intersection with

This function returns a couple containing the nearest intersection point (first param) with this plane and the normal at intersection point (second param)

Implements Shape.

bool Plane::is_intersected_by ( const Launchable &  l  )  const [virtual]

Returns whether this plane is intersected by a given launchable.

Parameters:
l : the incoming launchable to test the collision with

This function returns whether the launchable direction will lead to a collision with this plane

Implements Shape.

bool Plane::redirect_photon ( const Couple3D &  couple,
Photon &  ph 
) const [virtual]

Redirects (or not) a given photon depending on the probilities of this plane.

Parameters:
ph : the incoming photon to redirect
couple : first parameter contains the intersection point, second contains the normal at this intersection

This function determines if a photon will be aborbed, reflected or will pass through depending on the corresponding probabilities specified for this sphere It returns TRUE is the photon was redirected, and FALSE if the photon was absorbed

Implements Shape.
